intro: Orthocarpus tolmiei, commonly known as the Tolmie's orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, white or greenish flowers. Orthocarpus tolmiei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
